subject: Career
title: Framing: How You Present the Ask
description: A 60-second lesson on Framing: How You Present the Ask.

hook.text: 'I need more money' vs. 'Based on my impact and the market, here's what's fair.' Same ask, different frame.

buildup.text: Framing changes how the same information is received. Needs-based asks feel desperate.

discovery.text: Value-based framing positions you as a partner: 'Here's what I bring and what that's worth.'

twist.text: Even the word choice matters. 'I'd like' is weaker than 'I'm looking for' which is weaker than 'I'm targeting.'

climax.text: Frame the negotiation as collaborative: 'How do we close this gap together?'

punchline.text: Same number, different frame, different outcome.

quiz.question: Which framing is most effective in salary negotiation?
options: Value-based: 'Here's what I bring and what it's worth'
Needs-based: 'I need more to pay rent'
Emotional: 'I'll be upset if you don't'
